title: Paste images straight into Web IDE while editing Markdown files
description:
### Problem to solve

One of the most annoying thing for anyone who writes content in Markdown files in Web editors is images insertion.

### Further details

To insert an image with Web IDE, I need to stop writing text, upload image file, get that file name, and wrap it with the proper Markdown syntax.

The situation is even worse when I want to insert screenshot directly from clipboard. I have to somehow save it on my local file system first, then go through the cycle above.

The proposal is to automate this process, like it is done in the issue/MR description field for example. Another example of proper implementation of this feature can be found on https://hackmd.io


### What does success look like, and how can we measure that?

I paste image or image file directly from clipboard, or drag-and-drop it into contents of Markdown file → Image gets saved automatically → Proper image markdown "tag" gets added to the contents of the file.

title: Preview Pipeline Graph In CI Lint/ Web IDE
description:
### Problem to solve
* Easier CI pipeline/ job editing

### Further details
* Whilst editing gitlab-ci.yml in the web IDE/ the CI Lint, a preview of the resultant jobs and pipeline would make it that little bit faster to visualise the pipeline as a whole rather than just seeing individual information on the jobs and having to piece it together.

### Proposal
* Add a preview of the pipeline whilst editing/ after reviewing the gitlab-ci.yml file or using the CI lint

title: Timestamps in UI sometimes shows elapsed hours but renders days
description:
It seems the date and time which are shown by Gitlab.com are sometimes incrrect. Here the "Jobs" view of my CI Jobs:

![image](/uploads/5a6e7f11af29e238fb29235f06352a72/image.png)

Today is June 16th, all the jobs were executed yesterday (June 15th) but the text shown in the table says "vor 20 Tagen" or "vor 22 Tagen" which means 20 or 22 days ago.

Clicking on a commit which was done yesterday but is rendered as "vor 20 Tagen" i see this:

![image](/uploads/73bc29ec5881ed14e3497eda0d2e2d1a/image.png)

Well this is consistent with the Jobs-view but is also nonsense, because the commit was done yesterday, not 20 days ago.

In contrast of this, the pipeline view seams correct:

![image](/uploads/f75f10f3b77c1c7ecc80b1d8c30940ff/image.png)

Here you see everything is ok. And with the pipelineview in mind i think the other views should not show "vor xxx Tagen" (xxx days ago) but they should be rendered "vor xxx Stunden" (xxx hours ago).  I think your code shows the elapsed hours but renders them as days.

title: Better naming convention
description:
## What questions are you trying to answer?

Re-naming few words like Projects, Groups, Merge requests

* Change Project -> Repository _(see the image below)_

If we check the meaning of Repository (a central location in which data is stored and managed)

![image](/uploads/f3bed67732073279d76f66d4aa5cd9d4/image.png)

* Change Repository -> Code _(it is an actual place where we can read and write code)_

* Change Merge requests -> Pull requests _(Optional)_

[Whats the Difference between a Pull Request and a Merge?](https://stackoverflow.com/questions/21247482/git-whats-the-difference-between-a-pull-request-and-a-merge)

* Change Groups -> Organization

We can consider that the Organization is the main company who do the coding stuff and it is possible that the organization can directly own the repository or it can be owned by a project.

* Change Sub-groups -> Projects

For example, A company is working on a new product called "A" and we create a new project in GitLab with a name "A" and then created a  repository inside the Project.

## Are you looking to verify an existing hypothesis or uncover new issues you should be exploring?

_(Not sure what it is)_

## What is the backstory of this project and how does it impact the approach?

Naming is very important in our lives, it is a way to understand or recognize someone before we interact with a person and same goes for the naming of the features or the tools in the GitLab.

## What do you already know about the areas you are exploring?

It will help the users to better understand the GitLab and to easily navigate around.

## What does success look like at the end of the project?

It will easy for those people who are already familiar with the GitHub.

title: Remove bottom UI of new issue web form
description:
- This issue is a first step before doing https://gitlab.com/gitlab-org/gitlab-ce/issues/34258
- This will help get users comfortable with first submitting a title and description, and then use the sidebar for adding attributes.
- The benefit is that we reduce product complexity and have less repeated UI in the product that does the same thing.
- Power users can still use [quick actions](https://docs.gitlab.com/ce/user/project/quick_actions.html) in the description if they still want to add attributes during issue creation.

### Design
Get rid of bottom part of the new issue web form, i.e.:

![Screen_Shot_2018-06-15_at_23.27.22](/uploads/69d088d154c1a49e7aa301972c122709/Screen_Shot_2018-06-15_at_23.27.22.png)

title: [Rails5] Invalid single-table inheritance type: Group is not a subclass of Namespace
description:
> **Note:** add `rails5` to a branch name to trigger rails5 specific CI jobs.

https://gitlab.com/gitlab-org/gitlab-ce/-/jobs/75290232

```ruby
  1) Gitlab::Database::RenameReservedPathsMigration::V1::RenameNamespaces#namespaces_for_paths nested namespaces includes the namespace
     Failure/Error:
       found_ids = subject.namespaces_for_paths(type: :child)
                     .map(&:id)

     ActiveRecord::SubclassNotFound:
       Invalid single-table inheritance type: Group is not a subclass of Namespace
     # ./spec/lib/gitlab/database/rename_reserved_paths_migration/v1/rename_namespaces_spec.rb:27:in `block (4 levels) in <top (required)>'

  2) Gitlab::Database::RenameReservedPathsMigration::V1::RenameNamespaces#namespaces_for_paths for child namespaces only returns child namespaces with the correct path
     Failure/Error:
       found_ids = subject.namespaces_for_paths(type: :child)
                     .map(&:id)

     ActiveRecord::SubclassNotFound:
       Invalid single-table inheritance type: Group is not a subclass of Namespace
     # ./spec/lib/gitlab/database/rename_reserved_paths_migration/v1/rename_namespaces_spec.rb:44:in `block (4 levels) in <top (required)>'

  3) Gitlab::Database::RenameReservedPathsMigration::V1::RenameNamespaces#namespaces_for_paths for child namespaces has no namespaces that look the same
     Failure/Error:
       found_ids = subject.namespaces_for_paths(type: :child)
                     .map(&:id)

     ActiveRecord::SubclassNotFound:
       Invalid single-table inheritance type: Group is not a subclass of Namespace
     # ./spec/lib/gitlab/database/rename_reserved_paths_migration/v1/rename_namespaces_spec.rb:59:in `block (4 levels) in <top (required)>'

  4) Gitlab::Database::RenameReservedPathsMigration::V1::RenameNamespaces#namespaces_for_paths for top levelnamespaces only returns child namespaces with the correct path
     Failure/Error:
       found_ids = subject.namespaces_for_paths(type: :top_level)
                     .map(&:id)

     ActiveRecord::SubclassNotFound:
       Invalid single-table inheritance type: Group is not a subclass of Namespace
     # ./spec/lib/gitlab/database/rename_reserved_paths_migration/v1/rename_namespaces_spec.rb:74:in `block (4 levels) in <top (required)>'

  5) Gitlab::Database::RenameReservedPathsMigration::V1::RenameNamespaces#namespaces_for_paths for top levelnamespaces has no namespaces that just look the same
     Failure/Error:
       found_ids = subject.namespaces_for_paths(type: :top_level)
                     .map(&:id)

     ActiveRecord::SubclassNotFound:
       Invalid single-table inheritance type: Group is not a subclass of Namespace
     # ./spec/lib/gitlab/database/rename_reserved_paths_migration/v1/rename_namespaces_spec.rb:87:in `block (4 levels) in <top (required)>'

  6) Gitlab::Database::RenameReservedPathsMigration::V1::RenameNamespaces#rename_namespaces renames top level namespaces the namespace
     Failure/Error:
       Gitlab::Database::RenameReservedPathsMigration::V1::MigrationClasses::
         Namespace.find(namespace.id)

     ActiveRecord::SubclassNotFound:
       Invalid single-table inheritance type: Group is not a subclass of Namespace
     # ./spec/lib/gitlab/database/rename_reserved_paths_migration/v1/rename_namespaces_spec.rb:15:in `migration_namespace'
     # ./spec/lib/gitlab/database/rename_reserved_paths_migration/v1/rename_namespaces_spec.rb:231:in `block (3 levels) in <top (required)>'

  7) Gitlab::Database::RenameReservedPathsMigration::V1::RenameNamespaces#rename_namespaces renames child namespaces
     Failure/Error:
       Gitlab::Database::RenameReservedPathsMigration::V1::MigrationClasses::
         Namespace.find(namespace.id)

     ActiveRecord::SubclassNotFound:
       Invalid single-table inheritance type: Group is not a subclass of Namespace
     # ./spec/lib/gitlab/database/rename_reserved_paths_migration/v1/rename_namespaces_spec.rb:15:in `migration_namespace'
     # ./spec/lib/gitlab/database/rename_reserved_paths_migration/v1/rename_namespaces_spec.rb:238:in `block (3 levels) in <top (required)>'
```

title: [Rails5] expected: ["My title 358", "First Title", "Second Title"] got: ["My title 358"]
description:
> **Note:** add `rails5` to a branch name to trigger rails5 specific CI jobs.

https://gitlab.com/gitlab-org/gitlab-ce/-/jobs/75292429

```ruby
  3) Projects::AutocompleteService#milestones includes project and group milestones and sorts them correctly
     Failure/Error: expect(milestone_titles).to eq([project_milestone.title, group_milestone2.title, group_milestone1.title])

       expected: ["My title 358", "First Title", "Second Title"]
            got: ["My title 358"]

       (compared using ==)
     # ./spec/services/projects/autocomplete_service_spec.rb:103:in `block (3 levels) in <top (required)>'

  4) Projects::AutocompleteService#milestones does not include closed milestones
     Failure/Error: expect(milestone_titles).to eq([project_milestone.title, group_milestone2.title])

       expected: ["My title 362", "First Title"]
            got: ["My title 362"]

       (compared using ==)
     # ./spec/services/projects/autocomplete_service_spec.rb:109:in `block (3 levels) in <top (required)>'

  5) Projects::AutocompleteService#milestones does not include milestones from other projects in the group
     Failure/Error: expect(milestone_titles).to eq([group_milestone2.title, group_milestone1.title])

       expected: ["First Title", "Second Title"]
            got: []

       (compared using ==)
     # ./spec/services/projects/autocomplete_service_spec.rb:116:in `block (3 levels) in <top (required)>'

  6) Projects::AutocompleteService#milestones with nested groups includes project milestones and all acestors milestones
     Failure/Error:
       expect(milestone_titles).to match_array(
         [project_milestone.title, group_milestone2.title, group_milestone1.title, subgroup_milestone.title]
       )

       expected collection contained:  ["First Title", "My title 373", "My title 374", "Second Title"]
       actual collection contained:    ["My title 373"]
       the missing elements were:      ["First Title", "My title 374", "Second Title"]
     # ./spec/services/projects/autocomplete_service_spec.rb:128:in `block (4 levels) in <top (required)>'
     # ./spec/spec_helper.rb:197:in `block (2 levels) in <top (required)>'
```

 2) Gitlab::PathRegex TOP_LEVEL_ROUTES includes all the top level namespaces

title: Consider updating all API endpoints that accept comma-separated strings to also accept arrays
description:
We have a few API endpoints, like `PUT projects/id/merge_requests/iid`, that ask for arrays to be sent as a comma-separated list. 

Despite having this documented, it still is confusing sometimes, even to GitLab employees, since you can easily assume that sending an array would work, whether it be form-encoded or JSON.

Updating these parameters to accept BOTH a comma-separated string (so we don't break backwards compatibility) *and* an array is trivial, as you can see in https://gitlab.com/gitlab-org/gitlab-ce/merge_requests/19914 where I updated one endpoint to accept both.

Is this something we'd like to implement? I believe it helps us by subscribing to the principle of least surprise - "array-like" parameters should be accepted as arrays

title: Netlify tab under operations for JAMstack websites
description:
Add a Netlify (R) tab under the operations menu for static websites with dynamic functionality.

This so called JAMstack is the future for content heavy websites. But to maintain it you need some application functionality. https://www.netlify.com/ has made an identity service and a git gateway that are both MIT licensed (there will be an ecommerce service  called gocommerce in a few months). 

When you click on this menu you can deploy your repo to kubernetes, and deploy these services to kubernetes if you've attached a cluster to your project or group. It also has a one click button to deploy to Netlify.com if people prefer that since it has a global CDN. You need to log into Netlify with your GitLab credentials.

Way of working:

1. Kubernetes for backend, GitLab pages for frontend
1. Kubernetes for backend, Netlify CDN for frontend

We call it Netlify (R) instead of JAMstack because it will be good promotion for the Netlify (R) people who are open to actually building this if we approve it. I also think that their name will become synonymous with these kind of websites.

title: Include link to pipeline in git post-push message
description:
### Problem to solve

Currently, after a successful git push one will get either `To create a merge request for kubectl-helm-docker-with-git, visit: [link]` or `View merge request for kubectl-helm-docker-with-git: [link]`. This is great.

I propose that we also add the below if a push triggered a pipeline:

`remote: Pipeline 123 has started - track the progress: [link]`

### Why?

Convenience. Having stuff one needs at their fingertips.

### Suggested tags

- ~"feature proposal"
- ~"Accepting Merge Requests" 

CC @ayufan @markpundsack @markglenfletcher @bikebilly

title: Support migrations for Auto DevOps template
description:
### Problem to solve

Apps need to have databases configured before they work, and migrations run when they're updated. Auto DevOps doesn't currently have any way to support migrations

### Further details

1. When apps are first deployed, they sometimes need a database to be initialized before they'll even start running
1. When apps are updated and migrations are needed, they'll sometimes fail until the migrations are performed
1. Auto DevOps needs to support database initialization and migration

### Proposal

1. Support Helm post-deploy hooks to run migrations

### Notes/Questions

1. How can we know how to run database commands for every language? Some buildpacks have this built in, but some don't (notably Ruby/Rails buildpack). Ideally we'd just rely on Herokuish to configure this for us, but it doesn't work.
1. Even if we have good defaults, some teams may need to customize their database initialization and migration commands.

### What does success look like, and how can we measure that?

(If no way to measure success, link to an issue that will implement a way to measure this)

### Links / references

* From https://gitlab.com/gitlab-org/gitlab-ce/issues/44396

milestone.title: Next 3-4 releases
milestone.description:
Bigger issues we plan to ship in the next 3-4 releases, but don't have a designated release yet. 

DO NOT add small changes, bugs, regressions to this milestone.

title: Inconsistent line-height on soft-breaks following an emoji
description:
### Summary

Paragraph line-height is too large in lines following a soft break (`  `) if there is an emoji in the previous line.


### Steps to reproduce

* Add an emoji inline in a Markdown paragraph
* Add a soft-break (two trailing spaces) 
* Add additional text

### Example

This very issue should serve as an example.  
Line height correct

This very issue should serve as an example :blush:.  
Line height too high

### Screeny

![Screen_Shot_2018-06-15_at_11.26.14_PM](/uploads/4cc2f5d91c2415f52877875f8ce5fb2b/Screen_Shot_2018-06-15_at_11.26.14_PM.png)

### What is the current *bug* behavior?

* Line height is too large in this condition

### What is the expected *correct* behavior?

* There should be no difference between emoji/no emoji in previous line

~bootstrap4 label is an assumption!

title: Issue count is zero when there are issues present in new or imported projects
description: ### Summary Issue count showing zero in a project when there are issues present on newly imported projects. ### Steps to reproduce Import a project. ### Example Project https://gitlab.com/gitlab-com/account-management/Ericsson/Ericsson-RNAM/issues

title: MR "Changes between" menus are displayed behind version banners
description:
### Summary

The "Changes between" dropdown menus in merge requests appear below the banners indicating latest version and that not all comments are displayed.

### Steps to reproduce

Create a MR with more than 1 version. Change the version diff. Now that a banner is displayed, open the menu to change the diff version again. I can reliably reproduce using Chrome 66 and Firefox 59 on Linux.

### What is the current *bug* behavior?

Menus are covered making it impossible to click the desired diff version.

### What is the expected *correct* behavior?

The menu should be above everything.

### Relevant logs and/or screenshots

![Screenshot_from_2018-06-15_13-55-04](/uploads/9084aa9d72c95f64bf8d94fe350e392b/Screenshot_from_2018-06-15_13-55-04.jpg)

### Output of checks

This bug happens on GitLab.com as well as our private instance.
